data.name: #42 Poblano Stout
data.description: The Poblano Stout is not a chili beer. It is an Oatmeal Stout that has been dry hopped using roasted and de-seeded poblano peppers resulting in a wonderful smoky aroma with no heat.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.

data.name: '77 Stout
data.description: Named in honor of the Trail Blazers' only NBA title, this American stout has a smooth, full body and rich dark-fruit flavor from Belgian Special B malt, with a mild roastiness. It finishes dry...unlike a champagne-spewed celebration.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.name: 100 STEPS STOUT
data.description:
Tasting Notes:
Nose: Notes of caramel, dark fruit, and smoke
Palate: This beer starts off with a dry roasted taste, akin to coffee or dark chocolate. It then follows with a hint of malt sweetness immediately after. This then yields to more dark chocolate notes and slight herbal finish from the hops.

breweries.name: Springfield Brewing Company
breweries.description: An anchor to the re-birth of downtown Springfield since 1997, Springfield Brewing Company is a must-visit destination for beer and food enthusiasts traveling the area. Springfield Brewing Company is truly a wonderful facility, staffed with a great group of individuals. We bring together the finest brewing ingredients in one of the world’s best small brewing facilities to brew excellent beers. Local before local was cool, our kitchen matches our brewers passion for craft brewed beer with their made-from-scratch dishes with local products. We have no hatchet men or Madison Avenue suits on our staff; just a group of hard-working local business owners in search of excellence. Our mission is to brew inspired beer, produce excellent food, offer a superb facility while arming SBC with a personable staff. Cheers!

breweries.name: Draught Horse Brewery
breweries.description: Draught Horse Brewery will brew beer for businesses so that those establishments can sell their own branded craft beer, a high-quality signature house brew. This unique concept will be marketed by Draught Horse Brewery as “Brew-4-U”, a program that allows bars and restaurants --- that do not have the manufacturing Facility or brewmaster knowledge --- to brew their own unique beers. These establishments can now offer their own personal house brand tap. DHB will focus on its Brew-4-U Program with both In House and Distributor Keg sales. In addition, the manufacturing location will have a Taproom featuring both DHB craft beers as well as select DHB-brewed restaurant brands. Not only will DHB brew for businesses, owners will actually have the chance to try our product in our taproom!

data.name: 1847 Rye Stout
data.description: A dry, bitter, Irish dark ale brewed with malted rye and hopped with Columbus. Extremely dry and roasty. Delicious!

breweries.name: Lavery Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!

By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

breweries.name: Fall Brewing Company
breweries.description: A giraffe falls down a few escalators and an idea is hatched; let’s start a brewery!  Fall is a culmination of hungry humans starving for something they can commit to 110% and believe in…without having to answer to anyone.  “We wanted to create a place where we wanted to hang out, drink the beers we wanted to make, and not stuff anyone’s pockets that weren’t deserving of it.  So that’s what we did.” says company mascot and tasting room legend Eggmund. The rest as they say “is history” (in the making).

data.name: 2Xpresso
data.description: Espresso is a drink that is not for the faint of heart. Pulling a perfect shot is as much a science as it is an art form. Come to think of it, the same can be said for brewing beer. Of course, both coffee and beer have certain, shall we say, ‘uplifting’ qualities. To combine the two is a natural progression. Our 2xStout is considered by many to be a perfect milk stout. We started with that in mind, and added espresso beans and lemon peels for a true Italian style pick-me-up. The result is a stout so black, so rich, and so creamy, it’d be at home in a café served with biscotti. Yet, it’s beer.
data.foodPairings: Smoked poultry, buttery aged cheeses, shortbread cookies and cheesecakes, organic vanilla ice cream.

breweries.name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
breweries.description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

data.name: 3-D Stout
data.description: 3-D (Deep Dark & Delicious) Almost black in color, this dark and rich stout has a smooth upfront roastiness that finishes with a nice cocoa finish.

data.name: 369’ Stout
data.description:
Our 369′ Stout takes its name from Flathead Lake itself – its deepest point. It was developed after our award-winning Mutiny Stout. Creamy, malty, and full-bodied with a hint of crisp bitterness. Sometimes served on Nitro, making it creamier and more full-bodied. Oats, caramel, chocolate, and roasted malts give our Stout its deep, dark color and pronounced roasted flavor. Montana grown 2-row pale, caramel, chocolate, oats, and roasted barley malts. Simcoe and Cascade hops.

AWARDS: 2006 World Beer Cup- Silver Medal, American Stout

breweries.name: Flathead Lake Brewing Company
breweries.description: Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 on the east shore of Flathead Lake in Woods Bay, Montana and is home to handcrafted award winning beers, excellent food and spectacular views. Stop by our world class tasting room for one of our beers and sit back and enjoy the incredible mountain and lake views. It is a Montana experience to remember. Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 with a kitchen added in  March of 2010. FLBC endeavors to provide the highest quality product (all natural, unfiltered, and full of flavor) and customer satisfaction while supporting a responsible beer culture... “Quality Montana Lifestyle, crafted and brewed in the Flathead Valley”. The Brewery features ten premier award winning quality crafted brews as well as seasonal offerings. In addition to our focus on product quality, FLBC creates a positive experience for our customers by offering more than a great brewpub where people can come to relax and converse over great food and beer. It offers a place where people can come to learn more about the beer and the brewing process.

breweries.name: Piece Pizzeria & Brewery
breweries.description:
Piece unites classic New Haven-style thin crust pizza with award-winning microbrews in a spacious loft setting. We opened in July 2001 after transforming a roofing company garage into a casual pizzeria complete with a skylite ceiling and sunken lounge area. Sports fans can catch events on a series of eleven 42” plasma TVs that span the length of the bar. Revelers pack the house for games and special events. 

Opened in July of 2001, Piece has been producing small batches of our hand-crafted brews in our seven barrel brew-house. Brewer Jonathan Cutler had nine-plus years of brewing experience, having brewed at some of the most well respected breweries in the country. He is also a graduate of the esteemed Siebel Institute and received formal training from the Master Brewers Association of America.

Brewer Jonathan Cutler has won nineteen major awards in five years of operation. In 2006 Piece and Jonathan won the prestigious World Beer Cup Champion Small Brewpub and Brewmaster Award. Be sure to stop by and try one of our award winning brews.

data.name: 467 Ethan's Stout
data.description: 467 – Ethan’s Stout: Our stout is 5% alcohol by volume with all of the roasted barley flavor you expect balanced with caramel sweetness. The inspiration for our stout came by way of a great man named Ethan. Ethan went to the police academy with co-founder Jason wanting to serve as a member of the law enforcement community. Ethan’s life was tragically cut short due to cancer and we felt no better way to honor him than craft a beer in his honor. We hope this hand crafted stout reflects the flavors Ethan would expect and love from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Blue Blood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Our community is everything to us. We protected it as cops. We celebrate it as brewers.

Inspired by our roots in law enforcement and the homebrewing scene, our beer is meant to bring people together. It's crafted using the finest ingredients. It's scrutinized for strict adherence to our standards. It's brewed to be savored among the best of friends.

Because you have a right to know where your beer comes from. A right to great taste-and great memories. A right to have a little fun. 

We swear to uphold those rights.

Blue Blood Brewing Company. Justice. Served.

breweries.name: Branchline Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Branchline Brewing Company is a production brewery based out of San Antonio, TX. We focus on high quality craft beer utilizing local and regional ingredients whenever possible. Branchline Brewing Company's focus is not only to provide our offering to the extreme craft beer drinker, but also to the casual drinker that enjoys a lighter product. 

Handcrafted ales for the independent at heart

data.name: 6288 Stout
data.description:
Introduced in 2007, the 6288 Stout is our winter season specialty beer. It is a rather lengthy process to brew the 6288 Stout. It is brewed with 5 different malted barleys, using American and French hops. Keeping with the Tuckerman tradition, it is cold-conditioned, dry-hopped and bottle conditioned using the krausening process. The fermentation takes about two weeks, twice the time of our other beers and conditioning takes three months! It’s worth the wait, as the extra time gives this special brew time to mellow, offering a very smooth dark, malty flavor.

The 6288 Stout is named for the elevation of New England’s tallest peak, Mount Washington. Tuckerman Brewing Co. is a supporter of the Mount Washington Observatory and donates a portion of the proceeds from the sale of the Stout to the Observatory’s weather and science exploration. The Stout made Beer Advocate’s list of top stouts.

Tuckerman Brewing Co. brews our beer in the most green manner possible, using as many local ingredients and packaging materials as possible.

In 1998, Tuckerman Brewing Co. was founded with a love of the White Mountains of NH, in particular Mount Washington and the desire to create a fine hand crafted beer

Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: EPIC Brewing Company
breweries.description:
EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.  

In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.

breweries.description: We provide Tecumseh, Lenawee County, and surrounding areas with a warm and inviting neighborhood tavern in which we proudly serve eclectic and award-winning, house-made craft ales and lagers accompanied by an evolving menu of classic, high-quality pub fare using fresh and local ingredients. Our goal is to provide consistently friendly service.

breweries.name: Lonerider Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.

"Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

breweries.name: A1A Ale Works
breweries.description: Handcrafted and brewed to excellence, A1A Ale Works goes to great lengths to serve each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer has led to numerous awards.

data.name: Abuelita Stout
data.description: Over the hills and through the woods, this stout is welcoming and warms the belly on those cold days. Abuelita Stout is always there for you; spicy and sweet chocolate hugs your taste buds and wakes them up with infused, locally roasted Picacho coffee. Don't underestimate Abuelita Stout, she may seem innocent and nice but she packs a punch and can party with the best of them. Cheers!

breweries.name: Deadbeach Brewery
breweries.description:
Deadbeach Brewery makes El Paso quality craft beer for those that love beer... We are El Paso born and raised, dedicated to our fair city and our craft. Established in 2013 DeadBeach Brewery makes big, bold beers and doesn't hold back on the flavor. Our inspiration comes from the red glow of the Franklin Mountains and all the hard working people of the sun city. This is how we share our home with the world...

Cheers, beer loves you!

data.description:
DRAFT ONLY
Black as its namesake, with a creamy tan head, our Oatmeal Stout is velvety smooth with low carbonation. Six different malts, hops from the U.K. and (of course) oatmeal

contribute to this ale's complex character.
Join us in our Taproom and try a fresh Alberta Crude Oatmeal Stout.

breweries.name: Wild Rose Brewery
breweries.description:
Wild Rose Brewery, located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is a craft brewery that produces bottled beers and draught ales available to beer lovers in pubs, restaurants and liquor outlets all across Alberta.

All Wild Rose beers are unpasteurized and preservative-free. That's not because we are lazy; rather, it's a conscious choice to offer beer lovers the best products available in Canada. That quality is reflected in our six bottled beers and our draught-only classic ales.

data.description: A Traditional black rich stout, brewed using five different malts and best English hops

breweries.name: Adkin Brewery
breweries.description:
The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000.  It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire.  All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com.

At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job.  Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage.  As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!

data.name: Alldunup
data.description: Roasted malt, with caramel flavor. Very hoppy aroma and flavor.

data.name: Alligator Stout
data.description: This is a nice big black beer loaded with chocolate and coffee aromas, good roasted notes and breadiness. Rich, sweet in flavor and a nice amount of hops to balance it out.

breweries.name: Waddell's Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Our Brewpub & Grille in the Five Mile area is named after legend Rube Waddell, the eccentric baseball pitcher with a wicked curve and a blazing fastball, Waddell’s Brewpub & Grille is proud to offer Spokane’s Best Draft selection! Pouring some of the best Craft Brew’s in the Inland Northwest as well as our own beers brewed right here at our restaurant. Waddell’s is always rotating over 80% of our 50 tap handle line up. If IPA’s are what you crave then look no further then here with over 15 hoppy IPA’s on hand. Great brew’s, food and friends what every pub wish they had. Come to Waddell’s where you can meet new friend’s and buy your old mate’s a proper pint. Cheer’s!

data.name: Alpha Storter
data.description: The difference between a stout and a porter is a fuzzy grey area.  We are not quite sure if this is either… This dry beer is deliciously brewed with chocolate malt and two crystal malts to give it a strong malty backbone.  If you like dark chocolate, you will love this beer.

Aggressive Ales. 
Alpha Brewing Company is a St. Louis Microbrewery.

data.name: Alternate Side American Stout
data.description: Alternate Side is a bold Stout brewed with a blend of specialty dark malts that deliver a full body and rich flavors of strong coffee, dark caramel, and spicy rye. As those flavors fade subtle notes of Guajillo peppers, Chipotle peppers, and Cinnamon reveal another side to this delicate and complex beer.

breweries.name: Third Rail Beer
breweries.description:
Third Rail Beer is a New York City-based craft brewery, driven by a passion for the endless pursuit of quality, honoring brewing heritage, and pride in the culture and community of New York. We brew our beer using our recipes, techniques, and favorite ingredients on equipment lent to us by our brewery friends.

Third Rail beers offer sensory experiences that spark memorable moments and robust conversations, showcasing the wealth of variety and personality that comes from four simple ingredients. 

Look for us on draft at your favorite NYC beer bar, and keep an eye out for periodic limited bottled/canned releases.

Sherwood Brewing Company opened its doors on August 31, 2006 in the Hayes Center Shoppes plaza on Hayes Rd. north of Hall Rd. (M-59) in Shelby Township, Michigan.

We serve only the finest hand-crafted beer, wine, and sodas, all made in our on-site brewing facility.

Sherwood Brewing Company is proud and honored to be the recipient of WDIV's "4 the Best" award for Best Brewpub for four consecutive years (2007 - 2010) as voted by you, our customers.

data.name: American Stout
data.description: A dark, rich stout; black in color with a tan head. Our American Stout has a rich mouthfeel, a rich dark chocolate taste and a slightly roasty middle. This beer finishes with a little hop bitterness to round it all out.

Enjoy corn hole, big screen TVs and live music. Dog/kid friendly.

data.description: Big roasted malt aroma and flavor with bittersweet chocolate notes. Flaked oats create a silky mouthfeel, slight hop forward character balances nicely against the chocolate finish.

breweries.name: Fate Brewing Company
breweries.description: We do things a bit differently at Fate. Our beers are brewed in small batches, which means you'll find steadily rotating traditional favorites, experimentals, seasonals and cask conditioned ales on tap exclusively at the brewpub. At Fate you'll be offered a nifty opportunity to develop and expand your taste profile with our ever changing distinctive beers and wood-fired pizzas. Join us for a pint and a pie at Scottsdale's very own micro brewpub and put Fate in your hands!

breweries.name: Falls City Brewing Company
breweries.description: Falls City Beer is back! An old Louisville favorite has returned with a whole new recipe. Falls City Original Pale Ale is now available at dozens of local bars and restaurants. The new brew is made in the style of Falls City Pale Ale from the 1930’s. Falls City began as a craft beer in 1905, made in small batches with only the finest ingredients. As we start again, 105 years later, we are once again a craft beer with a commitment to quality and taste.

breweries.name: RAM Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
The Ram is a private, independent, family-owned and operated restaurant business. We were born on February 26, 1971 when our founders took their entrepreneurial spirit and experiences they received making pizza and serving beer at Shakey’s Pizza Parlor to open their own restaurant. That first restaurant was called the Ram Pub, which was a “Deluxe Tavern” that served hot food, including cook-your-own burgers and steaks, along with beer and wine.


Since 1971, the Ram’s primary commitment has been to always provide our guests with superior quality food and gracious hospitality. Although Big Horn Brewing Company is now one of the largest brewpub companies in the country, the goal of our brewers continues to be to produce the freshest, most “drinkable” beer of the highest quality.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Noble Ale Works
breweries.description:
Noble Ale Works is a microbrewery located in Anaheim, California at the Stadium Plaza Business Park in the Platinum Triangle. We are conveniently located between the Angels Stadium and the Honda Center.
 
Our goal is to create and maintain high quality full flavored craft brews for those who can handle it. "We are not here to convert light or non-beer drinkers; our beer is for people that already appreciate craft beer" We will never skimp on quality or freshness of ingredients, so that we can maintain the high profile flavor of brews that we at Noble care about.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Angry Chair Brewing
breweries.description:
The ultimate plan at Angry Chair Brewing is to brew beers that we like to drink. Right now we like to drink more sessionable styles: hoppy pale ales, Berliner weisses, low ABV saison, and other easy-drinkers. We plan to lean on these styles for our core beers. However, one thing we absolutely believe to be true is that the public will be choosing our “core” beers for us: if you like the beer, we will keep brewing it.
We’re going to have an extensive barrel-aged program as well, especially for sour beers.

We definitely hate being boring and doing boring stuff so you can look forward to experimentation and unique projects.

data.name: Anne Bonny Irish Stout
data.description: How about trying a glass of traditional Irish stout. Our stout however is not particularly dry and has overtones of dark chocolate and toffee. The infused nitrogen gives a wonderful cascading effect in the glass and a rich, creamy head. Particularly tasty when paired with our oysters on the half shell.

breweries.name: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
breweries.description:
In 1990 Larry came up with the idea to sell produce from the corner of Rt. 463 and Lower State Road. He took Dani and the three kids to meet the owner of the property, Al Walters. Mr. Walters took an immediate liking to the Jones family and allowed Dani and Larry to sell produce from his corner. Being a farmer, he even started growing corn and other vegetables for them. One day, Larry's father showed up with a bushel of live crabs and left them with Dani to sell. The crabs sold so fast that they picked up more crabs, shrimp, and other types of seafood too. In 1994, Mr. Walters passed away and Dani and Larry had to move on to bigger and better things. They rented a space in the Chalfont Village Shopping Center and opened a restaurant and fresh fish market. Dani and Larry did all the cooking. Larry would go to the fish market daily to ensure the freshest seafood. And with the help of loyal family and friends, Jones Family Seafood became a popular seafood restaurant in the area.
    Early in 2001, Larry received a mailing, the kind we all ignore, advertising "Brew your own beer". He was immediately hooked. After convincing Dani that this was a good idea, they met up with a "brew master", ordered the equipment, and they were on their way.

data.name: ANOMALY MILK STOUT
data.description: FACTION ANOMALY MILK STOUT IS MADE WITH STAR ANISE, TCHO CHOCOLATES CACAO NIBS IN BERKELEY, LACTOSE SUGAR & COFFEE FROM ROAST CO IN WEST OAKLAND. MADE TO TASTE LIKE A STOUT BUT HAVE THE APPEARANCE OF A PALE ALE. SERVED ON NITRO FOR THE ULTIMATE EXPERIENCE OF THIS SWEET “STOUT”.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

data.name: Anytime
data.description: Classic milk stout brewed with generous amounts of chocolate malt balanced with lactose sugar for body and sweetness. Dark, rich, brewed just right for anytime.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Top Shelf Brewery
breweries.description: Top Shelf Brewery, located in Manchester, Connecticut, is a nanobrewery who takes pride in brewing the freshest and most flavorful beer for local consumption. The brewery has a local bar feel with ample seating, a bring-your-own-food policy, and the service of pints, flights, and tulips, along with growler fills. Our taproom is open on Wednesdays and Thursdays 4pm to 8pm, Fridays and Saturdays noon to 9pm, and Sundays noon to 5pm.

locations.name: Top Shelf Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Wednesdays and Thursdays 4pm to 8pm
Fridays and Saturdays noon to 9pm
Sundays noon to 5pm.
